chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
items.plainText: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

items.text: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
items.plainText: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

items.text: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.
items.plainText: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.

items.text: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
items.plainText: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

items.text: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
items.plainText: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

items.text: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
items.plainText: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

items.text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
items.plainText: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

items.text: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
items.plainText: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

items.text: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
items.plainText: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

items.text: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
items.plainText: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

items.text: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
items.plainText: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

items.text: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
items.plainText: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

items.text: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
items.plainText: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

items.text: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
items.plainText: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

items.text: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
items.plainText: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

items.text: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
items.plainText: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

items.text: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
items.plainText: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

items.text: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
items.plainText: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
